title: List of Macclesfield Town F.C. seasons
text:
<a href="Macclesfield%20Town%20F.C.">Macclesfield Football Club</a> is an English <a href="association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Macclesfield">Macclesfield</a>, <a href="Cheshire">Cheshire</a>. The club played in the <a href="Football%20League">Football League</a> from 1996–97 until relegation to the <a href="Conference%20Premier">Conference Premier</a> was confirmed on 28 April 2012. The club was formed in <a href="1874%20in%20association%20football">1874</a> and the team play their home games at the 6,355 capacity <a href="Moss%20Rose">Moss Rose</a> stadium.
Key.
Key to league record
Key to cup records
Seasons.
The Silkmen spent much of the 20th century in the <a href="Cheshire%20County%20League">Cheshire County League</a> before becoming founder members of the <a href="Northern%20Premier%20League">Northern Premier League</a> in 1968. They were NPL champions in its <a href="1968%E2%80%9369%20Northern%20Premier%20League">first</a> two <a href="1969%E2%80%9370%20Northern%20Premier%20League">seasons</a>, beating <a href="Wigan%20Athletic%20F.C.">Wigan Athletic</a> to the title on both occasions. They were champions again in 1986–87, earning promotion to the <a href="Football%20Conference">Football Conference</a>. They were Conference champions in 1994-95 but failed to gain election to the Football League. Two years later they were champions again and gained promotion in successive years to spend 1998–99 in Division Two before falling back to the fourth tier of English football (Division Three/League Two) and then being relegated to the conference in 2012.
